results.title: Le Petit Parisien = the Little Parisian
results.brief_description:
Episode 1 of Series “Lagardere”.
Philippe de Gonzague has vowed to become the master of the richest estate in France. To achieve this, he has to destroy the lives of all those standing in his way. His first victim will be his friend Philippe de Nevers, his wife Blanche de Caylus and their young daughter, Aurore, who stands to inherit the estate. Gonzague sends two fencing masters, Staupitz and Cocardasse to eliminate Nevers, meanwhile, Henri (aka the little Parisian) who works as an acrobat in a travelling circus is told by his nanny the secret of his origins. As Henri comes out to stake his claim on his estate, he finds himself embroiled in Gonzague’s web of intrigue, murder and kidnapping. This popular story hs been adapted to the screen many times. See also in our collection: ‘The hunchback’ (X000159).

Credits: Producer, Robert Velin ; director, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; writers, Marcel Jullian, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; photography, Georges Barsky ; music, Jacques Loussier.
Cast: Jean Piat, Jacques Dufilho, Jean-Pierre Darras, Nadine Alari, Jacques Balutin, Claude Confortes, Marco Perrin.

results.title: Le Defile de Poncarbo = the Gorges of Poncarbo
results.brief_description:
Episode 5 of Series “Lagardere”.
Following his humiliation at the Regent’s ball, Philippe de Gonzague flees the court, taking Flor and Aurore as hostages. On his way to Spain, Gonzague and his aides stop at an inn. There they plot to assassinate their pursuant with the help of local ruffians.

Credits: Producer, Robert Velin ; director, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; writers, Marcel Jullian, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; photography, Georges Barsky ; music, Jacques Loussier.
Cast: Jean Piat, Jacques Dufilho, Jean-Pierre Darras, Nadine Alari, Jacques Balutin, Claude Confortes, Marco Perrin

results.title: Le Bal du Regent = the Regent's Ball
results.brief_description:
Episode 3 of Series “Lagardere”.
Aurore has moved in with Suzanne, Lagardere’s old nanny, to try and avoid the spies sent by Philippe de Gonzague. Henri is trying to track down Blanche, Aurore’s mother. Little does he know that she is now married to Philippe de Gonzague. Gonzague has devised a scheme to introduce to Blanche a young orphan named Flor who is to pass for Aurore.

Credits: Producer, Robert Velin ; director, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; writers, Marcel Jullian, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; photography, Georges Barsky ; music, Jacques Loussier.
Cast: Jean Piat, Jacques Dufilho, Jean-Pierre Darras, Nadine Alari, Jacques Balutin, Claude Confortes, Marco Perrin, Dominique Paturel.

results.title: Aurore
results.brief_description:
Episode 2 of Series “Lagardere”.
Lagardere is in hiding in Spain with Aurore. He is still seeking to kill all those involved in that fateful night at Caylus 15 years ago. Each of his murders his signed with the famous ‘Nevers lunge’, a bloodied star on the forehead of the victim. Philippe has married Blanche in the hope of seizing her estate. He also keeps an army of informers whose mission it is to locate Lagardere and kidnap Aurore.

Credits: Producer, Robert Velin ; director, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; writers, Marcel Jullian, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; photography, Georges Barsky ; music, Jacques Loussier.
Cast: Jean Piat, Jacques Dufilho, Jean-Pierre Darras, Nadine Alari, Jacques Balutin, Claude Confortes, Marco Perrin.

group_works.title: The Impact of the Second World War on Indonesian nationalism

results.title: The Impact of the Second World War on Indonesian nationalism
results.brief_description:
Episode number 14 of Series “War and society”.
The film shows how the Japanese encouraged Indonesian nationalism under the Japanese scheme for Greater Asia. Introduced by Donald Watt.

results.title: The Russians
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Tom Manefield, John Abbott and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Russians”.
A three part series examining life in the Soviet Union. This episode studies Kierov, Kuban, Belarussia and Siberia. Narrated by Nick Tate, cinematography by Dean Semler.

results.title: People of the cities
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Tom Manefield, John Abbott and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Russians”.
An inside look at how the Russians live, showing actual families in their homes, at work and their entertainment. This film deals with city life, in places such as Moscow and Odessa. Narrator, Nick Tate.
